definition.name: NXsimilarity_grouping

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n_lbl_num
symbol.doc: Number of numerical labels per object.

symbol.name: n_lbl_cat
symbol.doc: Number of categorical labels per object.

symbol.name: n_features
symbol.doc: Total number of similarity groups aka features, objects, clusters.

definition.doc:
Metadata to the results of a similarity grouping analysis.
Similarity grouping analyses can be supervised segmentation or machine learning clustering algorithms. These are routine methods which partition the member of a set of objects/geometric primitives into (sub-)groups, features of different type. A plethora of algorithms have been proposed which can be applied also on geometric primitives like points, triangles, or (abstract) features aka objects (including categorical sub-groups).
This base class considers metadata and results of one similarity grouping analysis applied to a set in which objects are either categorized as noise or belonging to a cluster. As the results of the analysis each similarity group, here called feature aka object can get a number of numerical and/or categorical labels.

field.name: cardinality
field.doc: Number of members in the set which is partitioned into features.

field.name: number_of_numeric_labels
field.doc: How many numerical labels does each feature have.

field.name: number_of_categorical_labels
field.doc: How many categorical labels does each feature have.

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc:
Which identifier is the first to be used to label a cluster.
The value should be chosen in such a way that special values can be resolved: * identifier_offset-1 indicates an object belongs to no cluster. * identifier_offset-2 indicates an object belongs to the noise category. Setting for instance identifier_offset to 1 recovers the commonly used case that objects of the noise category get values to -1 and unassigned points to 0. Numerical identifier have to be strictly increasing.

field.name: numerical_label
field.doc: Matrix of numerical label for each member in the set. For classical clustering algorithms this can for instance encode the cluster_identifier.

field.name: categorical_label
field.doc: Matrix of categorical attribute data for each member in the set.

group.name: statistics
group.doc: In addition to the detailed storage which members was grouped to which feature/group summary statistics are stored under this group.

field.name: number_of_unassigned_members
field.doc: Total number of members in the set which are categorized as unassigned.

field.name: noise
field.doc: Total number of members in the set which are categorized as noise.

field.name: number_of_features
field.doc: Total number of clusters (excluding noise and unassigned).

field.name: feature_identifier
field.doc: Array of numerical identifier of each feature (cluster).

field.name: feature_member_count
field.doc: Array of number of members for each feature.
